text:
NEVER TAKE YOUR CAR HERE, Trav's is OVERPRICED, NOT PROFESSIONAL, AND WILL RUIN YOUR CAR.

I took my c8 corvette to Trav's to have a set of AR Headers put in, he originally told me it would take 1-2 days and to drop it off on a monday. After he had the car for a week and did not call me about the job being done I called him and he said the car would be done in the next 24 hours. He had the car for another week and a half before giving it back. Next he proceeded to charge me $1500 for the job that should have taken a day (3-6 hours MAX). 2 days after having the car back it begun dying, after charging the battery it worked again but drained it again. The car was taken to the dealership who replaced the battery, but said that Trav's must have installed the headers incorrectly or messed up an electrical component. Trav's then refused to answer my call or another shop's call about the car.

text: Trav’s changed out the headers on my son’s c8 corvette. After they took weeks to complete the job, and over charged for the work, we finally got the car back. Then the car started dying all the time. A brand new corvette with only 4000 miles on it has now been towed multiple times, jumped multiple times & is sitting in a lot waiting to be transported to another place so a real mechanic can work on it. The car had no issues prior to him touching it, he did something to the wiring while working on the car. Trav’s refused my calls, hung up on me repeatedly, then blocked my number.  When I finally called from another phone and Trav answered he told me “I am done with that car”and refused to even look at it to figure out what went wrong with the install. He then proceeded to tell me “your son doesn’t deserve that car” and call me a “bitch” and hang up on me.

name: Jade Irving
text:
Wish I could put 0 stars. Took my car to this shop to get the catalytic converter replaced and he ran a compression test on the engine instead, which I did not authorize. I would never suggest a place that does not get authorizations on work preformed. What I did authorize was it to be put on a lift and the exhaust removed. Putting a compression test was a waste of my time and money as well as not a test one would use for a blown CAT, save yourself the headache and go to a more reputable muffler shop. I think maybe the owner and the workers would do some good to read exhaust systems for dummies so they don't make the same mistakes in the future. With that being said, do you really want someone working on your vehicle that doesn't understand basic troubleshooting and how to properly run diagnostics. Either way after he tells me my engine is trash (I'm interested as to how that happened in his hands) he offered to buy my vehicle, can we say shady. The most interesting part is all the assumptions without proper diagnosis. When I questioned the compression test, I never authorized, Travis the owner hung up on me, not sure why he felt the necessity to charge someone for something he couldn't even explain the necessity for. Honestly, this is not a good place as there are certified, reputable muffler shops in the surrounding areas, use those other places so you don't have the same horrible thing happen to your vehicle with no explanation. Buyer beware of shady tactics and unexperienced mechanics.
**I want to note that I'm pretty sure all the 5 star reviews are from his friends and family. Every 5 star review is from someone who has only 1 review or a husband and wife with the same review. He could be paying for the reviews or offering discounts I've seen shady businesses do this before.

text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

text: Absolutely avoid this place at all cost. I had a catalytic converter go bad and took it to this guy to replace. He installed one and I went on my way. My vehicle was still giving me issues so I began to inspect the converter. Come to find out it was installed backwards, flow arrows toward the engine. So I called him and told him, he assure me multiple times they could be installed both ways and the flow didnt mean anything. So I took the truck to a dealership and they ran diagnostics on it. They then tell me the converter is on backwards (reassuring what I had already known) and I have them turn it around. The truck continues to run poorly and the dealership ends up telling me the converter is too small. So I end up paying over 1000 dollars for a new stock converter, the 4 oxygen sensors the backwards cat burned up, and the wrong cat the muffler shop installed. This guy has no idea what he is doing. Not only did he install the catalytic converter wrong, he flat out put the wrong one on my truck.

name: Cheryl Phillips
text: Went in for tires however I had a brake light and headlight out on the driver side and had asked if they could fix it. I was told to come back that Saturday; May 2nd so that a mechanic can look at it. I went that Saturday and had the lights repaired. That same Saturday night my entire driver side taillight went out. I knew they were closed Sunday but I called just in case I could leave a voicemail to give them a heads up about me coming in on Monday; May 4th regarding the taillight. May 4th they tried to repair the issue however ALL of my lights started malfunctioning. They tell me to come back that Wednesday; May 6th so that their mechanic can look at it. They gave me a work order stating that they are working on diagnosing the problem in case I got pulled over for no brake lights, reverse lights, headlights or turn signal. They proceeded to pull my vehicle through the shop and when I got inside it I noticed an airbag sensor that was not there before. I asked John if he could have it cleared out and he said that he would have the mechanic do it on Wednesday and that it should be no problem. I then attempted to turn my AC on (which was on while they were working on it but John said that he had turned it off) but the AC wouldn't come on. I get out of my vehicle and ask John if he could have the code cleared because I felt that it was messing with the operation of my AC and it's been 90° lately. John then tells another employee named Skyler to come clear the code however the code does not clear. During this time the owner comes and introduces himself and asked me and another customer if we were being tended to, the other customer stated that he was already tended to then I stated that I was being tended to and pointed to my vehicle. The owner then leaves to never return again. They then proceeded to turn the vehicle off in hopes of resetting it however at that point the vehicle would no longer start. John then told me that I needed to leave and that I could return Wednesday to have their mechanic look at it but at this point, I had no dash lights, interior lights, exterior lights, no AC, no radio, no power steering, and sensors going off. The vehicle would no longer start up. I started to get upset, John claims I brought my vehicle in like that which is 100% untrue, I drove it in with no issues other than the driver taillight but I was unable to drive it away. I defended myself and vehicle over that statement then John pulled their doors closed while several employees including a manager/ assistant manager watched. I ended up having to call the police (because I had no clue what else I could or should do). The shop then claimed that I had a bad battery and that was the result of all of this however when they put a brand new battery in there it did NOT fix all the problems, the vehicle did start up and it did have headlights but that was it. After me refusing to tow my vehicle away and almost 2 hours later Mitch (I believe the manager or assistant manager) then offered to let the vehicle stay and have their mechanic look at it on Wednesday May 6th. May 6th, I went to go pick up my vehicle and John was working the front desk, they tried to hand me my keys in the lot hoping I would just leave immediately but when I asked for a full detail work order on what all had been done to my vehicle, I received attitude and was told that I should be happy that they fixed it for free and that they don't document all the work that's done on vehicles. I sat up there until I received a work order (over 30mins later) but when I received the "work order" it stated, "gave customer a battery and replaced 10 fuse". I told the mechanic that that was not a detailed work order but I was told that was all I was going to get. I do not believe that they would have fixed the damages their employee, John, caused to my vehicle if I did not have 4years of documentation from the one and only other mechanic I've been to, video footage from my own vehicle and computer readings from my Vivint smart security proving the condition of my vehicle.

text: The gentleman that help me was very kind.  he checked the brakes on a car and saw that I did not need new brakes and he was not trying to sell me something I did not need. I Highly Recommend going here...

name: Vance Olmstead
text: Although Midas is a national company this one has a mom and pop type vibe to it. they're extremely honest (which is surprising considering the business), and super professional. Today's visit had me going in and checking why my brakes are constantly squeeling. They took a look at it, and told me they were fine. They didn't try to replace something that wasn't broken, nor did they try to find something else wrong with my car. No charge and on my way within about 30 minutes. Highly recommend them!

name: Ben Carlson
text: The brothers who own the Tuscaloosa Midas, as well as the other employees, were very genuine and helpful throughout the whole process. They took the time to explain the problems I was having with the rear shocks on my car, as well as showed me how worn the shocks were. I would recommend the honest service of this shop to anyone who is deciding where to get car work done.

name: MultiplesOfNico
text:
Pretty much got scolded going here. Due to an issue that really wasn’t taken seriously.
I won’t be going here again.

My family and my boyfriend even drove the car. They still notice the problem.

Took it Hyundai and they actually diagnosed the problem.

name: Todd Erickson
text: Great team of technicians & office staff caring for customers .

name: Valerie Burnes
text: Shop of honest guys doing an honest day's work. Very friendly, very upfront with the costs.  There were no hidden charges or surprises. Very efficient work done as quickly as possible.  You don't feel like you are being taken advantage of.

name: Alexis Brewe
text: Very dissatisfied with my experience here. I chose Midas based on the great reviews and went to the shop to get an oil change and maintenance check, because my car had been shaking the last few days. The maintenance tech did not properly check my tires, inform me of the extent of damage to my tires, or give me any answers about the shaking. I had a tire blow on the interstate four days later that caused an incredible amount of damage to my vehicle. First time in my life that I’ve gone to a car shop and they haven’t recommended that I buy new tires, and I seriously wish they had. I wouldn’t go here again.

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for the feedback. We are very sorry to hear that you didn't get excellent customer experience we expect to be provided to our customers. We'd really like to talk to you more in regards to your experience, but we need some additional information from you first. Please click goo.gl/Htn9PP to tell us more about your visit. Thank you.

Will definitely return there next time I need work done.

text: Took our van for a quote that was outrageous. Said we would get one somewhere else and the man refused to give my husband the car keys back and that we would have to pay to have it towed. Said legally they have the right to refuse to return our vehicle to us. What’s legal is us signing a document that we will not sue them if we get in an accident after we leave their place and chose not to use their services. They can not legally keep our car no matter how unsafe it is. Once he said we are going somewhere else the guy said he was just kidding and would throw in a discount if we stayed Took it to Farrar instead for better service, price and done professionally.

name: Randy Lambert
text:
Unprofessional and Poorly Managed, Don't Go Here.

I went to Midas in Meridianville for specific (rear diff) and general (oil change etc) services, I choose to do business here after a midweek visit asking if they could provide everything I am looking for. The Manager indicated they provided those services and I made a 7:30 am appointment for a few days later. Appointment day I arrive at the appointed time to locked doors and wait 15 minutes for someone to show up, while I was waiting I noticed trash from the previous days services and appointments all in the service bays. With the late open and the trashy appearance I should have left as these are signs of poor management. They took custody of my vehicle for the remainder of the day, of which I had to call them at closing time to see if there was an update, they were unaware of the status and had to call me back. When I heard back from them they said it was done and we agreed I would pick up the following morning, when I arrived they indicated half of the things I asked to be done weren't done and they can not do them (rear dif & and tire service). I was not charged for the items but now I need to make another service appointment elsewhere.

Separately, one of the Technicians blocked my wife and kids in while they were dropping me off. I went out to ask him to move of which he replied "she can get by", I followed up and asked him to please move, she is driving a larger unfamiliar vehicle (my truck) and would appreciate some extra space. He slurred at me under his breath and attempted to coal roll me in the parking lot.

resp.text: Hi Randy, we are sorry that you did not have a positive experience at our location. If you'd like to tell us more, please visit https://www.midas.com/aboutmidas/contactus/tabid/167/default.aspx

text: I had a hard time finding somewhere to weld a new flex pipe on my car with short notice on a Saturday with my two screaming godless heathens. This place was amazingly accommodating! I consider myself pretty knowledgeable about cars and they taught me a couple of things. They worked me in as quickly as they could and kindly sent me on my merry Fast and the Furious way! The mechanic ran a great bead on my exhaust and I could not be happier with it. Whilst still lose consistently to Toyota Tundras this was a vast improvement in my driving experience! 10/10

text:
It's been more than serval years since I've been in a Midas store. What a pleasant surprise this was several days ago for me. From the first call
( live person BTW ) to schedule an appointment, to the inspection/estimate and repair to the final check out process this was a fine example of how to do business. No pushy sell folk trying to up sell me just a genuine help attitude. What a refreshing client experience this was for me with schedules and pricing being kept as promised. Thank you to the entire team for a job well done!
JP

text:
Don't bother making an appointment online, because it's useless. Made an appointment, got confirmation of said appointment, and when I got there I was told I didn't have an appointment because the online system doesn't actually make appointments for this location and it's somehow my responsibility to call them and make the appointment again. So needless to say I did not get service on the day I made an appointment, and I took my money elsewhere.

Mind you, this is not universal for Midas. I go to another Midas location in another state and never have this problem. Won't be returning to this location again, and I would advise the franchise owner to seriously rethink their appointment system.

text: You hear the stories of mechanics taking advantage of women all the time but not today.  This place is great and the guys who work here are the nicest you'll ever meet. He just wanted to show me something that could go wrong in the future so I could keep an eye on it.  I'm a pretty good judge of character and these guys seem very trustworthy and kind.  I'm definitely gonna go back if I need anything else done to my car. Highly recommend the Midas on Highway 31, Hoover.

They decided to hold off until 1:30 pm to start anything and then provided extreme estimates 3x what we talked about before I dropped it off. I only allowed them to change the oil and rotate the tires after the cheat attempt. Beware, brake estimate = $30!

The tires were not rotated because they forgot. The front desk guy simply told me they don’t need rotated as they put tires in a position to maximize rear traction on a 60:40 split front:rear AWD vehicle. He offered to show me a video. That ideology is technically wrong and now my tires will wear in this position for 20,000 + 3,000 more miles.

NEVER again. Go elsewhere to avoid a poorly organized and managed facility,

I then took the car back to see what could be done about it.  They said when they drove it around and stopped at slow speeds and highway speeds they didn't hear or feel anything. name: Hej E.
text:
Took my vehicle for an inspection at my nearest dealership. Learned I needed the outer tie rod ends done, among a couple of other things. So I shopped around for cheaper prices and came across Midas in Hoover, AL. Took my vehicle to have the radiator and outer tie rod ends replaced/repaired and an alignment done on January 29, 2015. A week ago or so I noticed something was off with the ride of my vehicle. It would pull and had a slipping feel when turning and braking and just driving in general. It worsened and I felt I shouldn’t be driving it. I started thinking I needed to take it back to Midas because something wasn’t right with the steering and suspension (which they’d “repaired”). On February 23, 2015, I cranked the car up to leave work and the steering wheel loosened and turned far right on its own. Called AAA to have my baby towed. The AAA guy instantly diagnosed it and said the tie rod wasn’t done right. The pin wasn’t inserted in the tie rod end. We found the bolt that came off in the parking lot.

All three AAA guys diagnosed the problem and confirmed about Midas improperly installing the outer tie rod ends. One even said that could be a lawsuit and Midas would eat the cost. Had I drove home, that could have been my life on the road. My baby was towed home on a flatbed and then towed straight to Midas the next morning on February 24, 2015. I was not confident in Midas working on my CRV again. Especially since they didn’t do the job right the first time and it had to be done again. And on top of that, the same technician from the first time ended up working on my car this time around. They apologized and claimed the part was defective. I seriously doubt that. This was completely their fault. Point blank.

And to top it all off, that same technician (initials TT, according to my invoice, I believe) that worked on my car both times and drove it out afterwards, stole $20 from my ashtray compartment. He reached down and picked something up off the floor and got out of my car while putting something in his pocket. We caught it before leaving and went back to confront the guy, a short white male that looked to be in his 30s maybe; thick southern drawl. They compensated my stolen possession…with the exact money he stole from my vehicle -- minutes before. We made a little scene about it. It’s the principle of the matter. I usually take my stuff out of my car when having it worked on or having it in the care of someone else. But I failed to completely take all my significant possessions out…like my frikin’ gas money left in the ashtray. Another technician informed us that that wasn’t the first time something like that happened around there and that ‘we didn’t hear that from him’.

So not only does Midas not properly repair parts on a car, they also search it and steal possessions. I’m not confident in the repairing of their wrongdoing. I’m wondering if something else might go wrong. Their credibility is shot with me. I actually feel I should be refunded the cost for labor, if not the whole amount. And since it was a "defective part," they should refund me the cost for parts since the problem had to be fixed (and hopefully it actually is, this time and nothing else goes wrong from them working on it). I will be going to the home office about this. I will reach out to corporate about this. I will review the hell out of this Midas location. A situation like mine was potentially life-threatening and a definite lawsuit waiting to happen. They will not be getting my business.

resp.text: Hey there, thanks so much for sharing this with us. Very sorry to hear about your experience. We'd love to have someone get in touch with you about this. Do you mind sharing your name and phone number with us via email? Please feel free to contact us at social@midas.com. Hope we can be of some assistance. Thanks again.

When I saw it I was very pleased, keep in mind the new muffler is significantly smaller than my stock, so Shawn took some extra piping to make it look perfect. I then started my car and was incredibly happy, it did and still does sound amazing. All for such an amazing price. I would give Shawn 10 stars if I could and I highly recommend!

name: Robert Milstead
text: I recently took my Dodge Challenger to Shawn to get some exhaust leaks fixed.  The car had always had some vibration and noise issues since I picked it up new.  The dealer couldn't figure it out and I had just about given up on the car, and was about ready to get rid of it.  Shawn discovered the exhaust system was all jacked up,  and was resting against the frame rails and the factory X-pipe was hitting the bottom of the floor pan.  Shawn took the time to redo and correctly align, level, and repair the factory exhaust.  when I picked up the car I could not believe it,  it's a totally different car,  smooth, no vibrations, no rotating noise, no vibrations thru the shoulder harness or shifter handle.  This is the fourth car of mine that Shawn has worked on and every single time the work has been outstanding with fair pricing.  I highly recommend the Exhaust Shop in Pelham for any Exhaust work you may need!

Me and the owner spoke the same language when it came to how he would go about making they system, and when all was said and done, the work truly exceeded my expectations.  The new sound has made me fall in love with my car all over again.  The shop is awesome and clean, the owner is very friendly and will do whatever it takes to satisfy your exhaust needs, and the prices are reasonable for the quality of work.  This may not be the cheapest shop out there, but it's DEFINITELY the best.  I wish I could give him 6 stars!

name: Tim D
text:
The most amazing exhaust work I've seen for such reasonable price. I have always had trust issues when it comes to letting people touch or work on my car. I love to detail it on a professional level and want everything on it to be perfect.

Shawn has gone above and beyond all my expectations. Not only could he fit my car in for a new exhaust system in that week, he also managed to get it done on the same day! Don't let the outside of the shop fool you. It may be a little dusty here and there, but that is the result of all the beautiful hard work that is put into the exhaust systems. The same day turn around for such amazing work is what still blows my mind!

My exhaust was done at another shop before, and for their sake I won't be mentioning their name. It was a disaster what they did. Not only was it done poorly, it didn't even last a full 3 years.

Shawn came to the rescue and fixed all their errors. With his work I received:
- Someone who listened to exact customer demands.
- A full explanation of what he was going to do.
- A quote to which he was really close when done. (Some places end up way over original quotes)
- Brand new exhaust brackets that prevent the exhaust from moving or rattling.
- Picture perfect welds that are painted over to blend in and prevent corrosion.
- An exhaust system that is level at every point (Yes, he proved it with a leveler)
- Flat black painted pipes to blend in with the underbody of my car where they are normally exposed.
- Weld points on the exhaust tips, on top of the factory bolts, to really secure them and keep them perfectly aligned.

For all that, the price he quoted me is by far more than reasonable. In fact, I feel like I owe him more for the immaculate level of craftsmanship he performed on my car. Definitely the place to go in Birmingham, AL. Thanks again Shawn!

When the 4 days were over i called to see if it was ready to be picked up. They said that the job was bigger than intended and that they needed a few extra days, fast foward to april 5th the day i finally picked up my vehicle. They had given me an array of excuses of why it took so long including that they had to weld the head for some reason and the head shop couldnt have them ready for a week. I got my car home turned it off and tried to start ot again , to my surprise the truck would not start. He charged me almost 1500 dollars for this job and theor is still water in my oil. Save your money and time and do not bring your car to this shop they are irresponsible and carelesss and have no type of priority when it comes to your car. name: Tom King
text: I gave my service experience a one star because there was no way to make it a zero star. I went in to get oil change and a get a quote on new master cylinder for my son's car. My son had a free oil change card that his mother gave him.  This his first oil change of his first car I bought him last year. He's had the card for over a year and it has no expiration date on it. The service tech "manager" said he didn't think the card was still good. Again, it had no expiration date on it. He said well it should've been signed by manager, though there's no place for it to be signed by a manager. The "manage" said well anyone could've just picked it up and put the date on it and brought it back.  I said I didn't do that nor did my son or his mother. I told him I didn't appreciate being accused of stealing a free oil change card. He said two other people did that yesterday. I said that is not my fault nor an excuse to accuse me of doing the same thing. He could not understand what he had done over a $34.95 oil change. He called the owner and the owner said the card fine, of course. He did not apologize for accusing me of stealing the free oil change card. He said he had to make sure it was ok or it would come out of his paycheck. Again, no reason to ever utter someone could have just picked one up and brought it in unsigned. All he had to say is he had to call his owner to see how to process the card not accuse me of possibly stealing it. With that lack of ability to understand the damage to the customer for your handling of this made me question giving someone like that the responsibility to work on the brakes on my son's car. So, I took my free oil change card from his fingertips and told the inexperienced "manager" that I'd take my business elsewhere. As I left he said the free oil change card was "null and void". He just had to be right. He would not listen to the customer who was getting ready to pay $559 for work plus and extra $36 for the full synthetic oil change. Hint empathy people. I only do business with people I like period and though I just met this guy he gave me reason not to like him in under 10 minutes. I had never been in a Meineke in my life until today and will never do so again. Thanks to this manager at the South Huntsville shop. I wonder if this is the intent of the Meineke representative who gave this card to my son's mother?

resp.text: Hi Tom, this should never be the impression we leave. Far from it; you should always expect the best from Meineke. We are sharing your feedback and we are continuing to focus on customer service. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us by visiting www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/

name: Jason Hughes
text:
Jaye at the front desk was very professional and courteous and the service was awsome so far, however I was charged 4 hours labor and it only took 2.. At over 100$ an hour labor, I had over 200 dollars stolen from me where service's were not performed... I have dealt with the public for a lot of years and in no way would my conscience allow me to do this to  my customers and then
try to  justify it by saying my computer says I have to.... This was my first and last time visiting Meineke...

resp.text: This is not the impression we should leave, Jason. Our car care professionals are all about building trust and confidence. We are escalating your feedback internally and would like to connect with you directly. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

name: Javan Gray
text: The service and this branch location was impeccable. Hunter the manager & my tech specialist Isaac were professional courteous and really went the extra mile to ensure that I was satisfied. They have definitely gained my business and I would personally recommend this location!

resp.text: Thank you for your wonderful review, Javan! Exceptional work and exceptional service are what it's all about. Thanks for shouting out Hunter, Isaac, and the team. You can count on our crew to go the extra mile. Happy to hear about the great work on your vehicle!

name: Ryan Davenport
text: I brought my car in for a radiator replacement due to a leaking radiator, what I got was a new radiator and a slew of problems. First issue was my skid plate was not reinstalled under the engine. The store manager told me that it probably fell off when I was driving and I didn't notice. They were able to replace that at no cost to me. Secondly, screws were missing and clips weren't reinstalled. The manager assured me they would be replaced, and they were. Lastly the radiator was mounted improperly (very wobbly, almost hitting the engine). This was initially resolved with plastic zip ties and told by the manager that it was repaired and I was good to go. Obviously this was unacceptable at an initial service fee of $105/hr. They did end up properly mounting the radiator but only after I noticed the "shade tree mechanic" level of work.

resp.text: This is definitely not the experience you should expect from Meineke, Ryan. We pride ourselves on expert craftsmanship and professionalism. Please reach out to us at www.meineke.com/about/customer-service/ or 1-800-634-6353. We hope to come to a resolution and earn back your confidence.

text: I came in to get an oil change. I spoke with Andrew Boutwell. He was very professional, knowledgeable, honest, and respectful. Andrew and the technicians were very friendly and prompt. Andrew took time to explain what was work was needed on my vehicle. My wait time was not long. The store/shop was very well cleaned and kept up. The service was top notch and the prices were great! Definitely recommend going to Meineke Car Care Center on south parkway to see Andrew Boutwell.

resp.text: We love to hear about experiences like yours, Amber. Thanks for shouting out Andrew and his team. We're all about being the best in customer service and doing car care right. We're glad to hear you and your vehicle were taken care of!

If i put any gas to the pedal, it dies. If they test drove my car, they would have known they made the problem WORSE. I am absolutely infuriated and I will be there first thing in the morning to settle this issue.

text:

Update-  Local store representative indicated "Corporate" would reimburse me for damage to oil cap housing.  "Corporate" called indicating any damages are the responsibility of the "Franchisee".  Once again, each is passing the buck but the customer gets hosed.  If the Franchisee is using the name "Meineke",  Corporate should be taking  more responsive action. text: I have used this Meineke many times in the past 9 months.  I travel with my job and always would stop at this location when I needed an oil change, battery, wiper blades and much much more.  The last time I was there the technician scared me in to spending over $800 in repairs that have never  been an issue before on a car that I bought new couple years ago.  I thought I would try them again, I just called for a quote on breaks, I explained all I needed was break shoes, and would like a  quote.  The man I was talking to told me to bring it in.  Again I said I just need a quote, he told me he could not give me a quote with out bringing it in for inspection.  I will never use Meineke again, that is how they lure you in, you take your car/truck there for something and before you leave they scare you to death saying something else is life or death.  I just wanted a quote on brakes..... Needless to say Budget Brakes (2 doors down from Meineke) was glad to give me a quote and has now put the breaks on my Nissan Altima.  BEWARE IF YOU GO TO MEINEKE, THEY WILL TRY TO SCARE YOU INTO SPENDING WAY MORE THAN YOU NEED TO SPEND.

Mind you the guy that helped me was very rude; I asked him what are my options and he said junk it because that’s what I have.  Fast forward twelve months later I  sold the car to a male friend; he had it towed back to Mike & Mike under his name and they replaced the battery and a few minor things for $700.  Ladies please don’t let this happen to you. This was absolutely unbelievable and I really enjoyed how quickly they use to fix my car and get it back to me.  I was truly taken advantage of and lost a good car.

text: Steer clear if at all possible. Not a good experience. Paid $200 even though couldn’t fix or diagnose problem after a few weeks. We paid though so we could get our car and didn't argue. The scary part was Mike and TJ were trying to get it back to their shop from dealership so they could have it in their possession once again and up charge us even though we had already paid them once. Fortunately we paid dealership who fixed it and got it back ourselves before they could. Dealership just shook their heads when they heard what was happening. text: Awesome service. Priced right and quick.

name: Michael Sulprizio
text: I found Mike& Mikes by doing a Google map search, which will go down as one of my best finds via google maps EVER. M&Ms fixed an ongoing issue i had for months & was around $150 cheaper from other shops around the area.  Thanks for taking car of my car...

name: Valerie T Porter
text: The absolute best experience you will have with a mechanic. Mike and his staff are extremely knowledgeable, while being fair with his pricing. I am a New Yorker, but have known Mike for at least 10 years, and I would not let anyone else touch my 2006 Volkswagen Passat except Mike. For me and my car, Mike & Mike is the best mechanic in Birmingham. (no, I am not, a paid reviewer.

name: Foster David
text: These guys are nothing short of the best.

name: Dean Ethridge
text: Mike and Mike's is where I will always take my vehicles.  They do a great job and get us in and out of there typically in the same day.  Very knowledgeable staff that are factory certified to work on BMW, Mercedes, Volkswagen and Audi.  They work on domestic too but very satisfied with the work they've done for us.

name: S Underwood
text: I called very upset when my car wouldn’t go into gear and I was stranded an hour and a half away from home. The gentlemen was very kind over the phone and sent someone to help me. The mechanic that came to help was very nice and honest. He explained the problem, got me calmed down, and back on the road.

name: Dean Ethridge
text: Mike and Mike's is where I will always take my vehicles.  They do a great job and get us in and out of there typically in the same day.  Very knowledgeable staff that are factory certified to work on BMW, Mercedes, Volkswagen and Audi.  They work on domestic too but very satisfied with the work they've done for us.

name: Terry Long
text:
I had a drive shaft hanger go out on my Volkswagen Touareg, around 11:00am. I contacted Mike and Mike's they had me bring it in to them (did I mention that this was a Friday?) the diagnosed the problem, ordered new parts, negotiated with my extend warranty provider, made my brother and I feel confortable waiting in the shop and, had my repairs done before 5:00pm. I have since spoken with people that have used them for repairs and all I've heard is great things about them.

Thanks for the great work guys

name: Mo'Nique Martin
text: Everytime I needed service on my car, they would give me the best prices,  the best service. Quick and fast with your car. Tell you everything that's wrong with it and they know how to get the job done. Best autoshop in Alabama that I know of.

name: Elizabeth Rogers
text: Mike has been my trusted go-to mechanic for many years. He helped me initially with repairs for my Volkswagen Jetta and now is helping me with my Subaru Outback. Mike has even gone out of his way to check what is wrong and give me a quote before proceeding with the repairs. I regularly recommend Mike to friends and coworkers.

name: Steve Forsyth
text: Do not take your car anyplace except to Mike and Mikes.  Mike is a fantastic mechanic and a great guy.  Mikes is even better!!!!!!!

name: Trey Horton
text: Mike is a great guy. Cares about his clients and does awesome work. Saved me half off what the dealership charged and his is Volkswagon certified!

name: Donna McCrindle
text: Good people. Fixed the car tho it took two trips.

name: Evelyn Bain
text: I had to take my car to them on a Friday to get the starter replaced and when the delivery for the part ended up not getting there until closing time they went above and beyond all expectations to make sure that I had my car back for the weekend.

name: Rodney Evans
text: Very professional and quality work! Wouldn’t use anyone else!

name: James Ryan
text: They are very friendly and helpful at the vehicles that they are working on and are very reasonable priced

name: William Perry
text: I had my car repaired there and other places didn't get it fixed

name: M May
text: Several years ago they worked on my Kenworth tractor. They were always very helpful.

name: Derma Laser Clinic
text: We have a BMW and Mike and Mike's saves us over half of what the dealer charges.  They do great work too

name: Denson Parker
text: Best place in Birmingham to get work done on your car.

name: Joel Haskins
text: These guys work great with you and do good job

name: Kerri O'Brien
text: Fast and friendly service.   Mike is great.

name: thomas schweitzer
text: Great service.

name: Kristi Martin
text: Found the problem with my car and I'll be back on the road

name: brent portera
text: these are fantastic people to do business with a+.

name: Shaun Benefield
text: Always willing to help even if its just advice on how to fix yourself. Used these guys for years now and will continue.

name: Tiffany Walker
text: This is actually called Jackson motorsport now! My husband works here. Friendly service and very knowledgable!

name: yawana peterson
text: Went there today day Mr. Raymond went above. And beyond for me will go back

name: Ted Bell
text: It's not Swain and sons it's Jackson motor sports and it's a top notch shop
